newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil soap opera murder trial starts.
newsitem.headline: Brazil soap opera murder trial starts.

text.p: The high-profile trial of an actor and his former wife accused of murdering his screen lover began on Wednesday in a Brazilian court after frequent delays, officials said.
Guilherme de Padua and Paula Thomaz are accused of stabbing to death 22-year-old actress Daniela Perez four years ago in a case that has gripped millions of Brazilian soap opera fans.

A judge at the Rio de Janeiro court earlier suspended the proceedings as soon as they began after de Padua's defence lawyer demanded the presence of a former Rio coroner, who had been giving media interviews.
The court later accepted as evidence one of the coroner's taped television interviews.
Prosecutors and defence lawyers agreed to separate the trials of the two defendants and the proceedings, expected to continue for several days, opened with de Padua taking the witness stand.
In the soap opera "De Corpo e Alma" (of Body and Soul), de Padua, now 27, played the brooding boyfriend of sexy teenager Yasmin, interpreted by Perez.
He originally confessed to murdering Perez, but later accused Thomaz, now 23, of carrying out the stabbing in a fit of jealousy. The two were married at the time but divorced after he was arrested.

The 1992 killing even eclipsed news of the ongoing impeachment of former President Fernando Collor and spawned calls for a crackdown in Brazil's justice system, where well-connected defendants often go unpunished.

If convicted, De Padua and Thomaz face a maximum sentence of 30 years in jail. But under Brazilian law, first-time offenders can be released after serving a sixth of their term. Both defendants have already spent the past four years behind bars.
